Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that two youth were in a bedroom unsupervised and they engaged in
sexual contact.
INVESTIGATION:
On January 3, 2022, a special investigation was initiated regarding the allegation
described above. Staff and youth were interviewed. Documents were also reviewed.
What follows is information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
On January 3, 2022, the Chief Administrator was informed that a special
investigation had been initiated. The agency self-reported the incident to Central
Intake.
2

On January 3, 2022, the Manager of Program Operations was interviewed and he
offered the following information. On December 28, 2021, Staff 1, a Senior Assistant
Program Manager, had approached him and reported that Staff 2, a Direct Care
Staff, had taken Youth A down to his bedroom while another youth, Youth B, was in
her bedroom. Staff 1 reported that Staff 2 then left the hallway unsupervised as she
thought another staff person was going to supervise the hallway and the youth in
their bedrooms. The Manager of Program Operations reported that if there is more
than 1 youth in the bedroom hallway or in their bedrooms that a staff person is
required to be present in the hallway supervising the youth. The Manager of
Program Operations reported that Staff 1 was preparing medications, came out into
the milieu and asked where Youth A was. Staff began looking for Youth A and he
was not in his bedroom. Staff began bedroom searches looking for Youth A and
found him in Youth B’s bedroom with Youth B. The Manager of Program Operations
reported that Youth A has previously been caught touching other youth.
On January 3, 2022, Staff1 was interviewed. On the day of the incident Staff 1
reported that she had arrived to work and Staff 2 and Youth A had asked her for
some deodorant and she was then in the medication room obtaining a deodorant for
Youth A. Staff 1 reported that when she exited the medication room she asked
where Youth A was as she was assigned to supervise him. Staff 1 reported that Staff
2 said she let Youth A into his bedroom. Staff 1 reported that she checked Youth A’s
bedroom but he was not there, she then checked the milieu and could not find Youth
A, so began searching bedrooms where Youth A was subsequently found by
another staff in be in Youth B’s bedroom. Staff 1 reported that it was her
understanding that Staff 2 had taken both Youth A and Youth B to their bedrooms
and they were then left unsupervised.
On January 2, 2022, Staff 3, a Shift Supervisor was interviewed. Staff 3 reported that
on the day of the incident Staff 1 had come out of the medication room asking where
Youth A was. Staff 3 reported that a subsequent search found Youth A in Youth B’s
bedroom. Staff 3 reported that Staff 2 acknowledged that she had taken Youth A and
Youth B to their rooms. Staff 3 reported that Youth A had told him that he tried to
have sex with Youth B but “could not get it in” and he tried to put his finger into
Youth B’s vagina but his fingernails were too big.
On February 9, 2022, Staff 2 was interviewed. Staff 2 reported that on the day of the
incident she had unlocked the bedroom doors of Youth A and Youth B to allow them
to enter their bedrooms. Staff 2 reported that she began exiting the hallway and
asked Staff 4, a Direct Care Staff, to supervise the hallway. Staff 2 reported that
when she was exiting the hallway she had her back turned away from a line of sight
of the bedrooms. Staff 2 reported that is when Youth A must have exited his room
and sneaked into Youth B’s bedroom. Staff 2 reported she lost line of sight for about
45 seconds. Staff 2 reported that when Staff 4 was supervising the hallway he
noticed that Youth A’s bedroom door was propped open. Staff 2 reported that Staff 4
then looked into Youth A’s bedroom and found he was not there. Staff 2 reported a
3

search for Youth A began and he was subsequently found in the bedroom of Youth
B, hiding behind Youth B’s bed.
On February 9, 2022, Youth A was interviewed. Youth A is a 13 year old male.
Youth A reported that he sneaked down to Youth B’s bedroom and could enter as
Youth B had propped open her door. Youth A reported that Youth B had encouraged
him to have sex with her but that didn’t happen. Youth A reported that Staff 2 had
found him in the bedroom of Youth B.
On February 9, 2022, an attempt was made to interview Youth B however she
refused the interview.
On February 10, 2022, Staff 4, a Direct Care Staff was interviewed. Staff 4 reported
that he was “one on one” supervision with a youth who he walked down to her
bedroom and allowed her to enter her bedroom. Staff 4 knew that Youth B was in
her bedroom that at the same time he began supervising the hallway. Staff 4
reported that at that time he knew of only two youth that were in their bedrooms,
Youth B, and the youth he was supervising one on one. Staff 4 reported that he
began supervising the hallway, sitting in a chair provided for staff when supervising.
Staff 4 reported that Staff 1 entered and he was asked to get Youth A. Staff 4
reported that he looked into Youth A’s bedroom but Youth A was not there. Staff 4
reported that a search begun and Youth A was found in the bedroom of Youth B.
Staff 4 reported that he estimated that Youth A and Youth B were in the room of
Youth B for up to 20 minutes as he had been sitting in the hallway for that period of
time not knowing that Youth A was also in the hallway bedrooms.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Incident Reports: Two incident reports, each dated December 28, 2021, one for
Youth A and one for Youth B, were reviewed. The reports did not add any additional
information.
Resident Supervision Guideline: This agency document was reviewed and
describes supervision protocols for staff when supervising youth.
Youth A’s file: Youth A’s file was reviewed and indicates that he has a history of
sexually acting out and inappropriate boundaries.
Youth B’s file: Youth B has a history of acting out behaviors and conflictual
relationships.
4

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: Youth A and Youth B were left unsupervised in the bedroom
hallway, allowing Youth A to enter the bedroom of Youth B
undetected for a period of time up to 20 minutes as reported by
Staff 4.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR: 2021C0214013
